author: milos88
content: The branch node stores a value as well. And in EVM case that's always an empty byte array, because keys are always 32 bytes

author: chfast
content: Thanks for the explanation. However, the Yellow Paper doesn't allow to store values in a branch node.

author: milos88
content:
I believe that the 17th item is the value. If the key terminates (ends) at the branch node, that's where your value is.
That's my understanding, but I could be wrong of course

author: _shemnon
content: I don't think it exists as an ERC.  Here's solidity's spec - https://docs.soliditylang.org/en/latest/abi-spec.html

content: Feels like it's in solidity's court to make it an ERC.  If other langs adopt the ABI it would make sense as an ERC, but then solidity cedes control and then the risk is the ABI may have features then solidity cannot support. ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
